column4: yeah when i try to install mplayer or totem-xine it tries to install them
i had the same problem..I just downloaded the tar.gz and uzipped to /usr/lib/win32...
but it still wants to install the package w32codecs because the apt system doesn't know that i have installed it myself
then to stop apt from trying to install everytime um...somebody help me with this I think its apt-get -f ?
is there no way to lie to apt and tell it you installed something?
oh ya..had to do that too. let me see if I can remember
I told you what to do man
edit /var/lib/dpkg/status and type ok for the program that is trying to install w32codecs
apt will think everything installed correctly and will never try to install w32 again!
where is says totem in that file, you'll see it says half complete or something like that, change it to ok
ok i think i got it
i actually just changed w32codecs to installed
